TopicTitle: No Stop in Kerbin Orbit (NSKO) Launch vehicle and example payload

Articles.Content:
I give you one of my newest NSKO spacecraft complete with an example/usable payload. Example payload is pretty usable, but may require adding things for landing, docking, etc...

The launch vehicle reaches speeds fast enough to cause a reentry effect.

Launch vehicle waiting on the launchpad with example payload: http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/792939615761353540/92D08C8565E6A030A5D24F09D178B55A8446DD88/

Reentry effect during transit to orbit around the sun: http://cloud-4.steampowered.com/ugc/792939615761344962/6ABE40419C35FDA1C0B1D43514EA9489F8800385/

The orbit around the sun. (Results will very depending on skill level): http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/792939615761351594/265DD14EA8B5517F5570AC988268F9801CF6A115/

The Example payload vehicle: http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/792939615761352446/F46D21D778CAB31EF8A807486D0AF9DF6073F47D/

Download link:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/o6lifd2srpw3z2m/NSKO%20Launch%20vehicle%20and%20example%20payload.craft

Got SRB? Ihate10char

Yes. The entire design uses SRB because there is no need to stop.

Please note on the second stage I usually coast for a few seconds and then start the other 4 engines. This seems to consistently leave Kerbin's Influence. This may be inefficient or a bad idea, but I haven't slept in a few days.

Warping in atmosphere is a bad idea, as I use very few struts to keep the part count down.

Edited April 4, 2014 by ProGamerGov
